captions.text: [CAR ENGINE REVVING]

CHRIS HARRIS: So what is the
point of driving a four-liter

RS when it's 4.5 degrees
and the road is wet?
Well, last drive of the year.

It seems a shame not to,
and I've always felt

passionately-- we've got
to use these cars.

If you own a car that's in the
UK and you only drive it when

the sun's out, well, you drive
it about twice a year because

it's always [INAUDIBLE]
raining.

Of all the Car of the Year
Awards, I don't really care

about any of them because this
matters m more to me.
[CAR ENGINE]

CHRIS HARRIS: That it will
do that all day long.
I just think it's--

well, it's immature,
but it's cool.
It's just cool, isn't it?
The oversteer is cool.

This car is cool
because of it.

MALE SPEAKER: How's
the new toy?

CHRIS HARRIS: Well, it's got
it's got a good spoiler for
[INAUDIBLE]
your lunch.

This is the last day of the year
when I'll actually use

the car, so I come to Wales,
come to Crickhowell.
Have sandwiches and driving.

That's what it's all
about, isn't it?

Definitely what it's
all about.

My only problem is that this
wing on the four-liter is at
nine degrees of attack.

So, officially a 3.8 RS is
better for putting a tea on
than a four liter.

Other than that, I'm
[INAUDIBLE].

It has to be said the
performance of the Michelin

Pilot Sport Cup tires is-- and
this is a technical term--
[BLEEP].
They really are [BLEEP].
They really are [BLEEP].

They've got four millimeters
of tread in the back when
they're brand new.

After we've shaved them
a bit in 2,200 miles.

So therefore we've got two
millimeters of tread and that

means that they just don't
clear any water away,
whatsoever.

The rear is well over 300
[INAUDIBLE], so it's not

perfect for driving in
this weather, but it
was dry this morning.
It was lovely.
It's a bit wet now.
We're doing some snorkeling.

I don't regret getting the car
out today at all [INAUDIBLE].
[CAR ENGINE]

CHRIS HARRIS: The other thing
about the tires not being very

good in the rain is that you
can do that all day long.
[CAR ENGINE]
[INAUDIBLE]

a bit immature, but that's
what I love this car.

Beyond all the winning Car of
the Years, and the fact that

it is something quite special on
paper, when it really just

makes you have fun and want to
involve you in the process.

It's only as good as what
you do with it.

Now, the best part about
this car is the engine.

The engine is just
magnificent.
Four liters.
Normally aspirated.
A smidge under 500 horsepower.
I don't think it matters.

I think it is the
best production
car engine out there.
It's just stunning.
It's so responsive.
It's a great-sounding engine.

It has torque from two and a
bit RPM, and yet it's still

absolutely going
like a bastard.

At eight and a half thousand
RPM, I can't fault it.
I really cannot fault it.

OK, I'm averaging about
19 MPG, but, you know.

Hearts do not bleed for
that being the case.
It's a great engine.

And it's the best thing
about this car.

Just sticking a car like
this in the locker
seemed wrong to me.

A four-liter RS should
be on display.

So I asked the nice people at
Porsche Center Bristol if it

could live in the showroom for a
few weeks where people could
at least see it.

Hibernation doesn't have to
be a solitary activity.

title: GT3 RS 4.0: Last Drive Before Hibernation - /CHRIS HARRIS ON CARS

comments.text:
I guess he had not bought them, because he had a one years test car - now 
the car is back to Porsche, refurbisht and sold as used car or part of 
their race driver program. You can rent a 911 GT3 as pure race car. But you 
have to realy drive races with them. Porsche offers you the car and the 
maintaince and spare parts. But tthsi service is not cheap - but if you 
find some advertising partner, it can be payable to drive at the Porsche 
cup, etc.

comments.author: kaos izm

comments.text:
Watching this video and having seen a few before from Chris Harris, I start 
more and more to think of him as a poet. A "the pure style of driving in 
not downsized real cars poet"! Most of us viewers are as much of a car 
maniac as he is, but the pure NA engine fascination, he really did express 
it with this video - without banging the car constantly to the rev limiter! 
Great job, very great job! I like this guy and his videos only because he 
can be so fascinated by any car that might hit the right button in him!﻿
comments.author: stocklausen

comments.text:
The 4.0 is such a brilliant, unadulterated drivers' car that for the last

again.﻿

comments.author: Cade Nguyen

comments.text:
Oh dude it sucks here, even with my parents decent high pay it still sucks. 
I mean yea the University's are good but it's not all true a lot of them 
pay for their reputation to the board etc the car insurance is extremely 
high but you can buy cars very cheap Maserati Granturismo only 26k, 
Lamborghini Gallardo Spyder 2010 is 50k etc, no firearms to protect 
yourself, lots of crime, a lot of unemployed uneducated racist people, 
stupid ridiculous laws. The health care is free but not all that good, lots 
of opportunists to make a good life for yourself like advice, support, 
financial backing etc, Very friendly police, high quality food, lots and 
lots and lots to see literally endless stuff events happening every night. 
I think the good definitely out weigh the bad but only if you have money as 
always. I have to say I kinda love it here but I don't in the long term. 
Especially the rubbish weather it's April and still no sunny warm weather!

I was talking about Switzerland having good education etc not UK I mean't

comments.author: Andrew Nguyen

comments.text:
Porsche.unlike ALL other sports cars are designed to be driven..and driven 
hard...take it to the track..push it to the absolute limits..smoke the 
tires...when your are done..take it to the dealer...thrown them the 
keys...pick it up in two days with new tires and maintenance..(assuming you 
didnt wreck it) and pay for your tires  and service (about 1000 plus tires) 
and you are back in action...this is why you buy a Porsche.....not another 
sports car that would cost way way way more to drive at that level...There 
is no other..
